main event: On 9 November 1952, witnesses observed a bright orange light in the sky above Auburn, Alabama, which moved rapidly north after being stationary for about 10 seconds.
interesting points: Witnesses included a first lieutenant and numerous students from Alabama Polytechnic Institute, who reported a bright light that changed color and hovered for a significant amount of time., The sighting occurred after a football game, which drew a larger crowd's attention to the sky., The object was described as approximately 1000 feet above the ground and moving at a rapid speed., Reports indicated that the object was soundless and showed no visible means of propulsion., The weather was clear, with conditions allowing for good visibility of the object.
witness description: Students and a first lieutenant in the area who observed the light during and after a football game.
